entry.title: Amazon EC2 Console adds ‘Verified Provider’ label for public AMIs
entry.summary: You can now use the ‘Verified Provider’ label on the EC2 Console to pick public Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) that are owned by Amazon verified accounts. Previously, customers would need to check the owner IDs of AMIs that were publicly shared to identify the source of the AMI. IDs of verified sources were not always… Read More »Amazon EC2 Console adds ‘Verified Provider’ label for public AMIs The post Amazon EC2 Console adds ‘Verified Provider’ label for public AMIs appeared first on GIXtools.

entry.title: AWS Lambda announces support for a new IAM condition key, lambda:SourceFunctionArn
entry.summary: AWS Lambda announces support for lambda:SourceFunctionArn. A new IAM condition key that can be used for IAM policy conditions that specify the ARN of the function from which a request is made. Starting today, when a function is invoked, Lambda will automatically add the new lambda:SourceFunctionArn condition key to the request context of all AWS… Read More »AWS Lambda announces support for a new IAM condition key, lambda:SourceFunctionArn The post AWS Lambda announces support for a new IAM condition key, lambda:SourceFunctionArn appeared first on GIXtools.

entry.title: Amazon RDS Multi-AZ option with up to 2x faster transaction commit latency is now available in Asia Pacific (Sydney) Region
entry.summary: The Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) Multi-AZ deployment option with one primary and two readable standby database (DB) instances across three Availability Zones (AZs) is now available in Asia Pacific (Sydney) Region. This deployment option give you up to 2x faster transaction commit latency, automated fail overs typically under 35 seconds, and readable standby… Read More »Amazon RDS Multi-AZ option with up to 2x faster transaction commit latency is now available in Asia Pacific (Sydney) Region The post Amazon RDS Multi-AZ option with up to 2x faster transaction commit latency is now available in Asia Pacific (Sydney) Region appeared first on GIXtools.

entry.title: ZDI-CAN-18020: SAP
entry.summary: A CVSS score 7.8 (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H) severity vulnerability discovered by 'Mat Powell of Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative' was reported to the affected vendor on: 2022-07-22, 2 days ago. The vendor is given until 2022-11-19 to publish a fix or workaround. Once the vendor has created and tested a patch we will coordinate the release of a public advisory.

entry.title: Windows 11 KB5015882 update fixes bugs causing File Explorer to freeze
entry.summary: Microsoft has released the optional KB5015882 Preview cumulative update for Windows 11 with 20 fixes or improvements, including new Focus Assist and OS upgrade features. [...]

entry.title: Ex-Coinbase manager charged in first crypto insider-trading case
entry.summary: The U.S. Department of Justice has charged a former Coinbase manager and two co-conspirators with wire fraud conspiracy and scheme to commit insider trading in cryptocurrency assets. [...]

entry.title: ZDI-22-1021: VMware ESXi TCP/IP Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
entry.summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of VMware ESXi. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.

entry.title: ZDI-22-1025: Siemens Simcenter Femap NEU File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
entry.summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Siemens Simcenter Femap. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

entry.title: ZDI-22-1024: Microsoft Windows win32kfull UMPDDrvStartBanding Use-After-Free Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
entry.summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.

entry.title: ZDI-22-1023: Microsoft Windows win32kfull UMPDDrvFillPath Use-After-Free Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
entry.summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.

entry.title: ZDI-22-1022: Microsoft Windows win32kfull UMPDDrvFontManagement Use-After-Free Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
entry.summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.

entry.title: ZDI-22-1020: (Pwn2Own) Inductive Automation Ignition ZIP File Insufficient UI Warning Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
entry.summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Inductive Automation Ignition. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

entry.title: ZDI-22-1019: (Pwn2Own) Inductive Automation Ignition Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
entry.summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Inductive Automation Ignition. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

entry.title: ZDI-22-1018: (Pwn2Own) Inductive Automation Ignition Missing Authentication for Critical Function Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
entry.summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Inductive Automation Ignition. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.

entry.title: ZDI-22-1017: (Pwn2Own) Inductive Automation Ignition Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
entry.summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Inductive Automation Ignition. Although authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, the existing authentication mechanism can be bypassed.

entry.title: ZDI-22-1016: (Pwn2Own) Inductive Automation Ignition Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
entry.summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of Inductive Automation Ignition. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.

The vendor is given until 2022-10-28 to publish a fix or workaround. Once the vendor has created and tested a patch we will coordinate the release of a public advisory.
